with Gabrielle Giffords ' husband, astronaut Mark Kelly, on Saturday night. He described the latest progress in his critically injured wife's recovery. "She's making progress every day," Kirsten Gillibrand said. She's using both sides of her body. She's able to breathe on her own. She's able to open her eyes and to show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing. So... it's an extraordinary amount of progress for a woman who sustained such a horrific injury that she did. The University of Arizona said in a news release Sunday that Gabrielle Giffords ' condition had been upgraded from critical to serious because she is no longer on a ventilator. Asked if he had "made peace" with Gulf War colleagues like Brent Scowcroft and Colin Powell who criticized his policies as vice president, Dick Cheney replied, I prefer to think of it as a truce, Brian. Spy"/> Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer has said that the Xbox 360 is not a games console. He told USA Today that its multimedia capabilities and Kinect support makes it an entertainment device. Xbox isn't a gaming console. Xbox is a family entertainment centre. It's a place to socialise, he said. "It's a place to watch TV. We have Hulu coming. It's the only system where you are the controller. Your voice, your gestures, your body."
